S.FORM: ya mamu ramas, pasaring ta micuw sunbaba’ la kay.
tatuli’ hang! pastukug ci tunux.
sinsi ya su ramas.
tatama’.
ya mamu ramas. pasba’un mu cimu ci sasunno kumaṟal ka nani’un na ita Itaṟal soni.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的泰雅語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Atayal language for food.

S.FORM: ya mamu ba’un mung ka ke’ na sinsi’?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi’ kaṟal tutux luṟi, ini mu ba’i’ mung.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ka yaba’ hari’ ka ke’ su sinsi’, ini mu pungi’?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: galuw lunpuw kinang tutux, katox sani.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: ramas linpagan mamu.
yaba’ haṟi’ ka ke’ mamu, lapagiy tutux luṟi.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: iya’ pakakaṟal, iceng haṟi.
agal ka patas mamu.
ho’, sinsi.
agal ci papatas mamu.
ṟumungi’ cu maras ci papatas la sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: agal ka papuṟut mamu.
ṟumungi’ cu maṟas ci papuṟut la sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kacik ci ka babang hang.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pakaciki’ cu ci papuṟut su aw?
pa’alax ta sababa’an la.
pakakatox ta babuw ni la, tehuk sani soni la kay.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: ima si su’?
Pawan Nokan cu wa.
ima’ si su?
ule’ cu ni Yukan Toṟeh, Pawan Yukan ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Yukan, and my name is Pawan.

S.FORM: ima’ si su’?
seyto’ cu ni Bakan, Pawan Nokan ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: I am Bakan’s student, my name is Pawan.

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ su’ ?
Temu Pawan ralu’ mu.
ima’ ralu’ ni yaba’ su’?
Iyung Pawan ralu’ ni ka yaba’ mu.
ima ka hiya?
hiya ga Kuras Walis.
Kuras Walis ka hiya, asuṟan mu malikuṟ.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Kuras.

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ ni ka hiya?
Kuṟas Yawi ralu’ ni hiya.
Walis Pawan ka ralu’ ni hiya ?
ho’, Walis Pawan ka ralu’ ni hiya.
Walis Pawan ka ralu’ ni hiya?
aṟat, Kuṟas Watan ralu’ ni hiya.
ima ka ci’uli haca?
yata’ mu ka hiya, Temi Pawan ka ralu’ ni.
ima ka ci’uli’ haca?
Iwal Pawan ka ralu’ ni, rangi’ mu ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Iwal。
She is my friend and her name is Iwal.

S.FORM: pira’ ingkaṟalan su la?
malapṟow ingkaṟalan mu.
pira’ ingkaṟalan ni hiya?
malapṟow sa’ing ka ingkaṟalan ni hiya’.
pira’ ingkaṟalan ni yaba’ su?
maṟimal ingkaṟalan ka yaba’ mu.
pira’ kora’ ka macsuse’ mamu?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: sa’ing ka asuṟan lu utux ka suse’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: kelan su na asuṟan malikuṟ?
ungat cu na asuṟan malikuṟ kung.
pira’ ci’uli ka utux moṟow mamu?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: paṟat ci’uli ka utux moṟow min.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: cel su lunpuw ci patas inu’?
cel cu lunpuw patas cika Hori’.
S.TRANSL: I went to school in Puli.

S.FORM: ima ka hiya’?
mama’ mu ka hiya.
amol papumahun ni ka mama’ su?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: cel mukensacu’ ka hiya.
ima ka ci’uli haca?
asuṟan mu kanel ka hiya.
cel mumaṟah ka hiya?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: cel mumaṟah moṟow ising ka hiya.
macsuse’ ka sa’ing haca?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: aṟat, masrangi’ ka laha’ haca.
Itaṟal si su?
ho’, Itaṟal cu kung.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I’m from the Atayal tribe.

S.FORM: Itaṟal ka cinngusun su?
ho’, ga Bunung ka hiya.
babawi’ ka yaba’ su?
ho’, babawi’ kora ka utux moṟow min.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: waṟal lunpuw patas ka suse’ su kanel la?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: ho’, musa uṟi la.
ba’ kumaṟal ci ke’ na Itaṟal ka suse’ su aw?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: ho’ ba’ kumaṟal ci ke’ na Itaṟal ka laha’ kaca.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: pira’ koṟa’ macsuse’ mamu?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: tugal kora’ ka macsuse’ min.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: magaluw mamu maki ci ka yaba’ yaya’ su?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: ho’, magaluw cu maki’ yaya’ yaba’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: magaluw su maki’ yutas yaki su?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, ini min pagaluw maki’ ci yutas yaki mu.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: ima ka nel su gilgan maki’?
magaluw cu maki’ yaba’ yaya’ lu asuṟan mu malikuṟ.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: minoh su inu’ ka isu’?
minoh cu Nanto’ kung.
S.TRANSL: I’m from [Nantou]. *The [Hualien] is free to change places.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka moṟow su?
cel Nanto’ ka moṟow mu.
cel inu’ ka inohan su?
cel Nanto’ ka inohan mu.
cel inu’ ka alang su?
cel Plngawan ka alang mu.
kanon ka musa’ su alang?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: mahnguw ka papasba’an la ga, musa’ cu alang la.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: kun ga, ule’ na Itaṟal
yona inu’ ka kaṟal soni aṟ?
makilux ka kaṟal, matata’ wagi’ la.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: gahṟa’ ka tanux aw?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: kapayux malukus ci lukus, gahṟa’ caṟung.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: makilux ka tanux aw?
ini kakilux wa, sabehul tikiy uṟi tantana caṟung.
yona inu’ ka kaṟal soni’ aṟ.
tantana caṟung wa, ini kakilux lu ini kagahṟa’ uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: yona inu’ ka karal malahngan hiya?
pakaṟak hangitux wa, ungat ṟaṟulung ka kaṟal uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: yona inu’ ka kaṟal tanux aṟ?
pakaṟak ka wagi’, nahna minsot ka awalax, matata’ ka hungu na amutux la.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: yona inu’ ka kaṟal cimunan hiya aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: nel yaba’ ka behuṟ sani.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: ramas ka kaṟal cimunan?
yaba’ ka wagi’, ramas caṟung.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: maha’ cu papasba’an ci ke’ la.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: papayux malukus ci lukus gahṟa’ caṟung ka kaṟal.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: maha’ cu la.
iya’ ṟungi’ maras ci taṟasi’, yaba’ awalax kira’ haṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: mpawalax aw?
pasbalung ci micuw, hala umolax cubay kira’ haṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: umolax la aw?
masot micuw hang, minnolax tikiy.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: umolax aw?
mahuṟi ka tu’uy, yona minnolax cubay wa.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: hunco’ mahuṟi’ ka hi’ si su? minnolax aw?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: ini’ cu aras ci taṟasi’, nel umolax tanux wa.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ya su ramas?
maku’ nel muhal ka tunux mu tinlaman yupan na bexuṟ.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: ya su ramas?
maku’ masmamuy ka tunux mu’, pinsawagen na wagi’.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: ṟumungi’ cu maras ci papatas la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: pakaciki’ mi’ su.
ṟumungi’ cu maras ci pataṟak la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ini cu aras uṟi, hata’ miniy aw.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: hata’ miniy ci papatas aw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: ho’, pabiniy cu ci papuṟut uṟi na.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: hata’ miniy ci nani’un sasan aw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: minnani’ cu moṟow kung la, aṟat cu.
S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: ṟumungi’ cu musa pakakilux ci ka tinbihlan mu la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: inah haṟi’ hali’ pakakilux ga!
ṟumungi’ cu maras ci ka tinbihlan la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: pagagaluw ta mami’ ci ka tinbihlan mu la!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: amol ka nani’un su cakan rex?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: pakani cu ci tinnahuk na papasba’an ci ke’.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: amol ka nani’un su cakan rex?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: pagagaluw ta mani ga, nel cu maras ci tinbihlan!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

S.FORM: hata’ pasboru’ aw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: ho’, hata’ ga!
hata’ pasboru’ aw?
aṟat cu wa, maha’ cu lunpuw ci patas.
siagal cu ci cacopah aw?
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: ho’, ni’ ka cacopah hani.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: ita ka gali’ haca aw?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: agal sa si Pawan, nel cu cumopah hang.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor, you ask Pawan to carry it for you.

S.FORM: masu’ su cumopah la?
masu’ cu la.
hunco’ su ini’ copah isu’?
masu’ cu cumopah kung la.
awi’ tikiy ka raxal hani, maṟukat la.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: ho’, maha’ cu magal ci ka gali’ hang.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: maṟukat caṟung ka garasu’ hani, awi tikiy.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: iya’ hang kay, ini’ cu tamasu’ cumopah na.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: pisco’ su kira’haṟi’ la?
mamaha cu malahang ci ka sinsi’.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: pisco’ su malax papasba’an ci ke’ la?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: mamaha min mawas ci ka rangi’ mu.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: pisco’ i malax papasba’an ci ke’ ka hiya la?
mamaha’ lumanguy ka hiya’.
oṟ, nel moṟow ka Iwal?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Iwal is at home?

S.FORM: awah matatama’ moṟow ṟik, nel sani ka Iwal.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: oṟ, nel moṟow ka Iwal?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Saun is home?

S.FORM: amol la sikalahan su hiyan? ungat moṟow ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: ima’ su aṟ?
yutas, kumuy cu, sigawah cu ci a’alu’.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Kumuy, please open the door.

S.FORM: ima’ su aṟ?
Pawan Temu cu, nel cu moh sunlalahaw tikiy sinang.
S.TRANSL: Pawan, I am Temu, I have come to play with you.

S.FORM: talagay ta kinbuse’ ini pakakatox la.
cubay wa! lunlungung misu’ caṟung, patisal ta tikiy hang.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: tatama’, abu’ ta ci ocya’.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: bahbah su caṟung wa.
abu’ ci ocya’.
talagay kinramasan abun ka ocya’ su hani.
kani’ ta ci pinnahgalan aw?
ho’ ga! talagay kinramasan taxan ka pinnahgalan su aṟ.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: ramas ni’un ka pinnahgalan hani?
ho’ wa, ramas caṟung ni’un.
inah haṟi’ moh mani ci kingabenan, masu’ tumahuk ka yaya’ la.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: ho’, muhala’ cu mema’ ci aba’ hang.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: iya’ kasaṟux kay, aṟat su’ ci’uli’.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: matangi’ cu la, talagay ka kinnane’en mu.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: iya’ kasaṟux, kapayux mani’.
ho’, ṟamas caṟung ni’un wa.
maha’ cu la, mamoh cu matox sinang babuw ni luṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: ho’, pasagagiy ta la.
maha’ cu la, malahngan la.
awah salahaw babuw ni luṟi kay.
kinhayuw maskakiy.
ho’, awah salahaw moṟow mu i mahnguw su’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: ramas mamu? rasun mini matisal ci nannabkis ni sinsi’ soni’.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: ho’ wa, mamaha ta makakaṟal ci ke’ na Itaṟal ci ka nanabkis.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說泰雅語。

S.FORM: patehuk ta haṟi’ la?
patehuk ta haṟi la.
nel min matox sinang la tas.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: talagay mamu kinramasan, ba’ mamu’ kumaṟal ci ke’ na Itaṟal.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說泰雅語啊!真是太棒了!
You guys speak Atayal! That’s great!

S.FORM: ramas mamu? rarasun mu cimu cika atu’ na tuṟakis kira’.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: sinsi’, ho’.
iya’ ṟungi’ ci angaya’, awah matikaluw sani.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ho’, masmasu’ min magal ci angaya’ la.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: ini’ ta’ tehuk na?
ini’ na? tuhya’ na wa.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: usa’ puse’ ci use’.
ho’ maha’ cu puse’ ci use’.
usa’ magal ci sasecuw kabahni’.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: ho’, maha’ cu sumecuw ci kabahni’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: ramas mamu? mamaha’ ta’ ci ka tonguyen kira’
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: talagay kinramasan, payo ta inu’ musa aṟ?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: patapanga’ ta’ ci basu’ musa.
awah matakaluw sani, pabiniy ta’ ci kipu’.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ho’.
taxi’, kakabahni’ ka nel galeng, bukuy haca ga kukuya’.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: mangungu’ cu caṟung ci kuya’ kung sinsi’.
eṟi nak ga, usa’ matox ci kabahni’ isu’.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: utux wagi’ la ga, awah masasli’ sani kay.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: bahbah su’ sinsi’.
amol intaxan su’ soni’?
payux ka kuya’ lu kabahni’ kintox mu.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: inah haṟi’, mamaha ta’ la.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: na’ cu tikiy, nel masauṟiy ka papak mu na.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: pagaluw ta’ musa’ lumanguy aw?
ho’, hata’ ga!
talagay ka ci’uli’ nel lumanguy sani.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: ṟaṟik ka use’ saca hiya’, languy ta’ sani’ ita’.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: yo su na inu’ moh aṟ?
minkahakiy cu.
tinpanga’ su’ ci ṟaṟulu’ amol aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: tinpanga’ cu ci basu’.
yo su’ na inu’ musa’ kiyokay aṟ?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: pinanga’ cu ci ṟaṟulu’ ni yaba’ mu.
yo su’ na inu’ musa’ papasba’an ci ke’ aṟ?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: tapanga’ ci ceyun musa’ papasba’an ci ke’ ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: yona inu’ musa’ miniy ci ṟagu’ ka yaki’ su’.
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: tapanga’ ci otobay ka yaki’ mu.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: payo su’ na inu’ musa’ Lani aṟ?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: patapanga’ cu ci hune’ musa’ Lani.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: patapanga’ ci amol musa’ Lani ka hiya’ aṟ?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: patapanga’ ci hikoki’ musa Lani ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: patupanga’ ci amol musa’ Kawsyong ka hiya’?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: patapanga’ ci kawte musa kawsyong ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: patupanga’ ci kisya’ musa’ Taytong ka hiya’?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ho’, patapanga’ ci kisya’ musa Tayto’ ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: patupanga’ ci kisya’ musa’ Taytong ka hiya’?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: aṟat, patapanga ci hikokiy musa Tayto ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: kelan na papahngagan ci basu’ ka syaw hani?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: kelan wa, magalu’ing su musa la ga, taxan su la.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka subeh carung eki’ na ceyun sani?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: as ki ka tapanga’ hayya’ wa, ungat la pahngagan na ceyun sani.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: piṟa’ wagi’ tupangan su basu’ nanu’ papasba’an ci ke’?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: patehuk haṟi’ malapṟow ṟamagal hunkang tehuk papasba’an ci ke’.
maha’ piṟa’ wagi’ tupanga’ kawte tehuk Taycong?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: utux wagi’ ga tehuk Taycuw la.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: maha’ buse’ pata’uṟit ci ṟaṟulu’ nanu’ Ulay?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: patehuk haṟi utux wagi’.
maha’ kito’ kinbuse’ tupanga’ su’ ceyun tehuk moṟow mu?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: hala mapusal hunkang.
ba’ su’ paritensya’?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: ho’, ba’ cu paritensya’?
kelan su’ na otobay.
kelan cu tutux na otobay.
kelan su’ na otabay?
ungat otobay mu kung.
patisali mi su’ aw?
ho’ ga.
patisali mi su’ aw?
aṟat payux ka kinnaba’un mu, iya’ aw.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: mak musa’ cu matisal sinang gaben, mahnguw su’ aw?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎？我想去拜訪你可以嗎？
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you. Is that okay?

S.FORM: ho’, non misu moṟow kay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: patisal ta’ tikiy ci insa’ na Itaṟal cuxan i maki’ su moṟow aw?
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於泰雅族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of [the Atayal]. *[Amis] please change to your respective tribe

S.FORM: aṟat cu pakikiy moṟow cuxan, mamaha cu nanahi’.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: pinungan mu kumaṟal ka ci’uli ga, isu’ ka ba’ caṟung ci insa’ na Itaṟal ma, pa’uci haku’ tikiy.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對泰雅族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Atayal, I would like to ask you a question.

S.FORM: pa’ucan misu ci kinnuba’un mu’, aṟat sun payux ka kinnaba’an mu uṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: ho’, eṟi nak.
piṟa’ ingkaṟalan su’ la?
ma’iru’ mapgan maspat ka ingkaṟalan mu.
se’eneng su’ na wa.
wah, nabkis cu kung la.
minoh su’ inu’?
minnoh cu Maṟosan.
Itaṟal ka kanel su’ uṟi?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是泰雅族人嗎?

S.FORM: aṟat wa, Bunun ka hiya’.
amol ka ke’ ba’un su’ kumaṟal?
ba’ cu kumaṟal ci ke’ na Itaṟal lu Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我會說泰雅語和布農語。
I can speak Atayal and Bunun.

S.FORM: ma’as caṟung moh matisal sinang, pa’uci cu ci gagaṟux na maloṟak aw?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ho’, makaruṟux cu musa’ maloṟak i se’eneng cu hang.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: talagay kinramasan ka pissaba’ su’ soni’, bahbah su’ caṟung.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: cincaṟung ka ke’ mu hani. sinbili’ na nabkis rali’ kay.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: bahbah su’ caṟung, tehuk sani ka pintisalan ta’ soni’.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: patisal ta babuw ni la, bahbah su caṟung.
mamaha cu hang, mamoh cu mung ci ka isa’ na nabkis rali’ sinang babuw ni luṟi.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: ho’, kinhayuw musa’.
ramas su’, amol babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: pabiniy cu tutux ci kopu’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: ramas su’, amol babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: pabiniy cu tutux ci tamuku’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: kelan ka kopu’ mamu aw? pabiniy cu.
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: kelan, pira’ ka babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: maginbiniy mamu ci sabiki’?
ungat wa! ini min paginbiniy ci sabiki’.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: mpabiniy cu ci box.
pira’ cabu’ babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: ana tugal cinnabon.
mpabiniy cu ci ngahi’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: waṟal su’un maginbiniy kora’ ka ngahi’ la.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: mpabiniy cu ci sa’ing susuk na abura’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: mastahaṟ ci utux susuk baliy la.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: siusa’ cu miniy ci baṟing.
maha’ pira’ babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: maha’ pira’ ka baṟing babinarun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: sa’ing toting ka binarun mu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: mpabiniy cu ci sa’ing binnahlan na inuw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: tugal binahlan nel sani, agal kora’ la!
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: pira’ pila’ ka utux cinabu’ na box hani?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: sa’ing kabhul utux cinabu’ hani.
mapusal utux kulabuy kora’. anak mapusal kulabuy la ga.
bahbah su’ caṟung.
ni, ma’ira mapgan ṟamagal ka kulabuy hani.
patong cu miniy tikiy, patehki mu utux kabhul kulabuy.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: ṟamagal kabhul malapṟow kulabuy kora’.
ana’ ṟamagal kabhul kora’ aw?
kahyuw tikiy aw, maskitu’ caṟung ka hani?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: aṟat wa, mahyuw caṟung ka hani la.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: mpabiniy cu ci kamce’ hani.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: matul kulabuy ka kamce’ hani, amol ka babinarun su’ na?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: anak cu kuncik ci pila’ sinang?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ho’ ga! pira’ ka kacikan su’?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: anak cu kuncik ci pila’ sinang? ṟumungi’ cu maras la.
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ini’ cu nak aras ci pila’ uṟi wa!
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: anak cu kuncik ci pila’ sinang? ṟumungi’ cu maras la.
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: aṟat cu, ini’ haku beni ka kincikan su’ pilaw na.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: anak cu kuncik ci lukus su?
ho’, agal nak.
anak cu kuncik ci patas su?
wal mu pakacikan ci ka Iwal la.
pakacikiy cu ci ritensay’ su’ aw?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: ho’, wahi’ matu’ cuxan kay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: nel umolax la, ini’ cu aṟas ci taṟasi’ pakacikiy cu ci taṟasi’ su’ aw?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎？
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can I borrow one?

S.FORM: pagaluw ta maktaṟasi’, utux baliy ka taṟasi’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: ni, kani ka patas kincik mu sinang pilaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: patas amol ka maktaxan su’ na, kaṟali’ cu.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: babi’ misu kanon ka pila’ kincik mu la?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: eri nak, maki ka pila’ su’ la ga , beni cu la.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: babi’ su’ kanon ka pila’ kincikan su kinang la?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: be’an mi’ su’ cuxan la.
S.TRANSL: I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: kanon babi’ haku ka patas kincikan su’ la?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: wal misu be’an ci hiṟa’ la ca?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: pinkacik sinang ni Yukan ka papatas hani?
S.TRANSL: Did Yukan lend you this pen?

S.FORM: ho’ kincikan mu hiyan soni.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: kincikan su Yukanan ka papatas hani?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Yukan?

S.FORM: aṟat wa, bininiy ni yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: usa’ kacik tikiy ci timu’ ni Temi hang, ungat ka timu’ la.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, go borrow some from Temi.

S.FORM: ho’, maha’ cu kuncik.
wahi cu matu’ ci pila’ kincikan su’ si Temi.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Temi to give me my money back.

S.FORM: piṟa’ ka pila’ alu’ing ni sinang?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: mamaha su’ inu’?
mamaha cu mamuhi’ ci ṟagu’ ṟagu’an ki.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: cel su’ hunco’?
nel cu minnarang ci kaman wa. payux caṟung ka kaman, papuse’ cu ci use’ kira’ haṟi’ la.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: ita ka keweh lu lalabah mu haca?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: cel su’ puson inu’ aṟ?
cel mu pacelun ci ka syaw na ot.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: tinbulan su’ ka ṟaxal la?
S.TRANSL: Have you turned over the soil?

S.FORM: masu’ cu tumabul, pagaṟa’ cu la.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: tana’ halan kumit ka ṟagu’ pinmuhi’ su’ la?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: tana’ kutan ka tamana’ hani hiya’ la, ini’ ka ciyak hiya’ na.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的大黃瓜就還不能收成。
The cabbages here are ready to harvest, but the cucumbers there are not yet ready to harvest.

S.FORM: talagay ka ngahi’ kinehul su’ aṟ!
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: rogiy cu pusa’ kuhu’ ṟik aw?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: cel mamu’ hunco’?
nel min pusa’ ci ṟakuk kakaṟak ci ucyux.
S.TRANSL: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: payux ka ucyux sani aw?
payux ka ucyux kinṟak cel cika kobu’ la.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: yo mamu’ na inu’ kunṟak ci ucyux?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: as cu usa’ meta’ ci ucyux kung.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: ba’ su’ mulata’ na panelu’?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: kunṟak cu na binong, kung. ga, tagit cu maras ci huṟil lu hapuy musa’ muloṟak.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: tu’uy pinkakayan na baṟok nanahi’ hani.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ ba’un?
papak na baṟok ka hani, kani ka tu’uy naha.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: yona cel tunruṟi’ ci asinuw ka binong ta’ la, hali’ ta’ matox.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ ba’un?
yona wal sunkanux ka huṟil la, ululi ta’ musa’.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

S.FORM: amol ka nel su’ sabale’an?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: katu’ sinbale’ na uṟati’ kani, kakaṟak ci olit.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: amol ka cel su’ pusan saca hiya’?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: binong tatiruṟi’ ci papak kani, kakaṟak ci para’.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: talagay payux ka bini’ na amutux itan soni.’
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: ho’ wa, hali’ ta’ pasa’un mani’ ci raral alang.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: pasba’un mu cimu ci kakaṟal ci asinuw na Itaṟal kira’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的泰雅族怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Tayal language today.

S.FORM: pasba’un mu cimu ci kakaṟal ci kahuni’ na Itaṟal kira’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的泰雅族語怎麼說。

S.FORM: pasba’un mu cimu ci kakaṟal ci pinnahgalan na Itaṟal kira’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的泰雅語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Tayal language today.

S.FORM: iya’ abel.
iya’ kaṟal.
iya’ kani ci nani’un.
agal ka patas su.
agal ka papatas su.
agal ka papatasan su.
sukuy ka patas su.
sukuy ka papatas su.
sukuy ka nani’un su.
sukuy ka sasalahgan su.
iman ka papatas hani?
kinang wa.
iman ka patas hani?
Pawannan wa.
iman ka papuṟut hani?
ini’ mu ba’i’.
lukus ni Piyu ka haca?
aṟat, Iwanan ka lukus pababawen hani.
sinsi’, ini’ cu aras ci patas.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: pagaluw matox bang na intana’an su hang.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: maṟgung ka papatas mu la.
kacik intana’an hang.
patasi’ na enpicu’.
ungat ka papuṟut mu la.
kaciki’ ka papuṟut mu.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: pa’alax ta papasba’an la, kinhayuw musa moṟow kay.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心。
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: ho’, bahbah su sinsi’.
pa’alax ta papasba’an la, pasagagiy ta la kay.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: pasagagiy ta la sinsi’.
ye mamu’ ramas, Watan ka ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Yakan.

S.FORM: Watan ramas su.
ye mamu’ ramas? Temu ka ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Temu’.

S.FORM: Temu ramas su.
Yukan cu kung, ramas su.
Yukan, ramas su, Sapu cu kung.
ramas su, Temu cu kung.
Piyu ramas su, Sapu cu kung.
ima si su?
yaya ci ni ni Walis, Bakan ka ralu mu.
ima si su?
suse’ cu ni ni Watan, Apiy ka ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我是Watan的妹妹，我的名字是Apiy。
I am Watan’s sister. My name is Apiy.

S.FORM: ima ka hiya?
sinsi’ mu ka hiya, Iyung ka ralu’ ni.
ima ka ci’uli’ haca?
asuṟan mu malikuṟ ka hiya, Watan ka ralu’ ni.
Yukan ka hiya?
ho’ Yukan ka hiya.
Yukan si su?
aṟat, Walis cu kung.
ima ka Yukan hiya?
kuṟing ka Yukan hiya.
ima ka Sapu hiya?
rangi’ mu ka sun Sapu hani.
amol ralu’ ni ka asuṟan su kanel hiya?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: Kumuy ralu’ ni ka asuṟan mu kanel. hiya.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is kumuy.

S.FORM: amol ralu’ ni ka suse’ su kanel hiya?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: Yabung ralu’ ni ka suse’ mu kanel hiya.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Yabung.

S.FORM: ba’un su ka ralu’ ni?
Yukan ka ralu’ ni hiya.
pira’ ingkaṟalan ni ka asuṟan su malikuṟ?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: malapṟow ṟamagal ingkaṟalan ni ka hiya la.
pira’ ingkaṟalan ni ka suse’ su malikuṟ?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: ṟamagal ingkaṟalan ni ka hiya la.
kelan na papasba’an ci ke’ ka alang mamu?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: kelan aṟ.
cel su lunpuw patas ci ka alang su?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ho’, yo min na utux moṟow maki ci ka papasba’an ci ke’.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: ima’ ka malikuṟ haca?
mama’ mu ka hiya.
ima’ ka kanel haca?
asuṟan mu kanel ka hiya.
ima’ ka ule’ haca?
suse’ mu malikuṟ ka hiya.
amol ka pumahun ni yaya su?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: cel musapitay ka hiya.
amol ka pumahun ni yaba’ su?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: cel musinsi’ ka hiya.
suse’ su malikuṟ ka hiya?
aṟat, rangi’ ni suse’ mu malikuṟ ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: asuṟan su kanel ka hiya?
aṟat, suse’ mu kanel ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: pira’ ci’uli’ utux moṟow naha?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: ṟamagal ci’uli kora utux moṟow naha.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: pira’ ka ule’ moṟow mamu’?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: paṟat kora’ ka ule’ moṟow min.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: pira’ ka suse’ su?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ungat ka suse’ mu malikuṟ, ga, tugal ka suse’ mu kanel.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: pira’ ka asuṟan su?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ungat ka asuṟan mu.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: pira’ ka macsuse’ su?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ungat ka macsuse’ mu.
macsuse’ mamu?
ho’, asuṟan mu malikuṟ ka hiya.
Itaṟal mamu’ cimu?
ho’, Itaṟal min cami.
Bunung ka hiya?
ho’, Bunung ka hiya.
magaamol ka kaṟal soni?
gahṟa’ haṟi’ ka kaṟal soni, papayux haṟi’ ma’abu’ ci use’ na makilux.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal soni?
makilux haṟi’ ka kaṟal soni, kapayux haṟi’ ma’abu’ ci use’.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal tanux?
yaba’ ka wagi’ soni taxi’ nak haṟi’.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal tanux?
paṟulungan wa, ungat wagi’ ka kaṟal.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal cuxan?
ungat ka wagi’ cuxan, paṟulungan lu yaba’ ka behuṟ uṟi’.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal pilaw?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: gahṟa’ haṟi’ soni wa, palukus ci pababawen musa mamu tanux.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: magaamol ka kaṟal pahngawan aṟ?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: maha ramas ka kaṟal pahngawan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: pawalax ci kaca?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: patawagi’ ci kaca. aṟat pawalax.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: pawalax ci kaca?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ho’, pawalax ci kaca.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: nel umolax micuw?
masot la, matata’ ka wagi’ la.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: nel umolax micuw?
umolax la, ini’ cu aras ci taṟasi.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: umolax tanux?
ini awalax micuw hang. gaben ka pawalax ni, aras ci taṟasi musa mamu tanux.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: pakagahṟa’ muhla’iy ka kukaṟal?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ho’, pakagahṟa’ muhla’iy ka kukaṟal, papayux haṟi malukus.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: pakakilux ka abagan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ho’, pakakilux ka abagan, papayux ma’abu’ ci use’.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: sunkisli’ su ci kaṟal na pakabagan?
hulhul ka kaṟal na pakabagan, kisli mu caṟung.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: sunkisli’ su ci kaṟal na pakmuhla’iy?
payux behuṟ ka pakmuhla’iy hiya’, aṟat mu kisli’.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: ṟumugi’ cu maṟas ci patas. la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: pagaluw ta matox.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: ṟumungi’ cu maṟas ci papuṟut. la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: pakaciki’ mi su.
ṟumungi’ cu maṟas ci papatas?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ho’, pakaciki haku ci papatas su aw?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: amol nani’un su cakan na rex aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: pakani’ cu ci pang.
amol nani’un su gaben la?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: pakani cu ci mami’.
amol kine’ su ci ka sasan?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: minne’ cu ci baṟing.
amol kine’ su cakan na rex?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: minnani’ cu ci gilung.
hata takeru ci boru’.
musa’ kalama’, han misu malahang kira’ la.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: hata’ lumanguy.
ho’! ga, pagluw ta musa.
hata’ pasboru’.
aṟat cu, mamaha’ min rumili’ ci patas.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: innox su ci apnux la?
ini’ na, nel cu umox ci ṟating hang.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: pitawasan su ngawa su la?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: pintawasan mu la.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: minnox su ci ṟating la?
innoxan mu ka ṟating mu la.
hunco’ su ini pema’ ci aba’.
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: piman mu kira’ la.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: hunnaco’ su ci micuw?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: minsa’ cu malahang sinsi’ mu.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: pisco’ su i malax papasba’an ci ke’ la?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: mah cu insa’ moṟow. la.
pisco’ la malax papasba’an ci ke’ ka hiya aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: mamaha’ mayugi ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Apiy, nel su moṟow?
nel cu wa, awah ṟik.
Apiy, nel su moṟow?
ungat moṟow Apiy wa! Iwal cu kung, amol la sikalahang su hiyan aṟ? panucan mu i moh ka hiya la.
S.TRANSL: Apiy不在家耶!我是Iwal，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告。
Apiy is not at home. I am Iwal. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: ima mamu’?
yaki, Sama laha ci Apiy wa, sigawahi’ min ci a’alu’!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Sama 和 Apiy，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Sama and Apiy, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: ima?
Piyu cu kung, moh cu malahan Pawanan.
S.TRANSL: I am Piyu, I am here for Pawan.

S.FORM: yaki, nel cu matox sinang la ga.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: lunlungun misu caṟung la wa, buse’ su ini’ awah la.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: moh cu tikiy salahaw sinang ga.
S.TRANSL: I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: buse’ cu nak palamoh sinang la, awah matatama ṟik.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: talami mani’ ka ngahi’ pinmuhi’ mu hani.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看。
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: cacibing ni’un ka ngahi’ hani.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: awah! talami’ mani ka pinnahgalan pinmuhi’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: cacibing ni’un ka pinnahgalan hani.
tatama’! talami mani ka atiy pinmuhi’ mu aṟat pinse’en ci ayu’ kani.
S.TRANSL: 請坐!這是我種的有機玉米吃看看。
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: aṟ! cacibing ni’un ka atiy hani. wa!
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: pakani’ su ci namuru’?
pakani cu ci ringgo ini cu kani ci namuru’ kung.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: pakani su ci kamce’?
ho’, sunkisli cu mani.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: sialit misu ci pinnahgalan aw?
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: payux aṟingu’ ka pinnahgalan hani wa, bahbah su.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: siagal misu ci use’ a’abun aw?
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: bahbah su.
kapapux mani’ kay, payux tinnahuk mu ka raramat.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: aṟ! talangay ramas ni’un ramas sinkanaxan ni.
S.TRANSL: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: kapayux mani’, hungel nel sani na.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: aṟat cu pakasaṟux la kay!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: kapayux mani’, hungel nel sani na.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: payux kine’ mu la, tana’ la wa.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: rarasun min ni nanahi’ ni sinsi’ kira’.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: payux putut nanahi’ ma ka yaya.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: rasun ta ni mumaṟah ni sinsi’ kira’.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: mamaha min tumabuṟ?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta inu’ kira’?
rarasun ta ni syaw na luling ni sinsi’.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta inu’ kira’?
rarasun ta ni nanahi’ ni sinsi’.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta syaw na luling kira’?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: aṟat, rarasun ta ni nanahi’ ni sinsi’.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta nanahi’ kira’?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: aṟat, mamaha ta mumaṟah kira’.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: amol halan ta matox syaw na luling sinsi’?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: maha’ ta matox ci lalosan.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: amol halan ta matox nanahi’ sinsi’?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta matox ci ṟapiriy.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta hunco’ mumaṟah aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: mamaha ta matox ci atiy pinmuhi’ ta mumaṟah, taxi’ haṟi’ ka mama’ laha’ ci banga’ kay.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷。
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta lumanguy syaw na luling sinsi’?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in No, we are going to see dragonflies. the river?

S.FORM: aṟat, maha’ ta matox ci lalosan.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta mamuhi’ ci ṟagu’ mumaṟah sinsi’?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: mamaha’ ta tumabul kira’.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: cel mulaka’ saca kora’ ka lalosan.
nanak soni’ mintox cu ci minyanux na lalosan kung.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: cel mulaka’ saca kora’ ka ṟapiriy.
wa! talagay kinramasan taxan ka ṟapiriy, kisli’ mu caṟung.
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: cel mulaka’ saca kora’ ka ṟapiriy.
banga’ ka ca, aṟat ṟapiriy.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: iya’ usa’ tuhya’ caṟung kay, katox sani tana’ la.
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷。
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ho’, aṟat min maha’ tuhya’.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: iya’ tatalang, kinhayuw maskakiy mayakuṟa’ mamu’.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: mak ininah cu matox. ga.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: yo su nainu’ musa’ nasali’?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: pasṟaṟulu’ cu musa’ nasali’.
yo nainu’ musa’ moṟow ising ka hiya?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: maskakiy musa’ moṟow ising ka hiya.
yo su nainu’ musa’ Ponghu’?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: patapanga cu ci hikoki’ musa Ponghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: yo su nainu’ musa’ Ponghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: patapanga cu ci hune’ musa ponghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: patapanga su ci amol musa moṟow?
tapanga’ cu ci ceyun musa moṟow.
Yabung’ patapanga’ su ci amol musa papasba’an ci ke’?
S.TRANSL: How does Yabung go to school?

S.FORM: tapanga’ kisya musa papasba’an ci ke’ ka Temi.
S.TRANSL: Temi goes to school by train.

S.FORM: patapanga’ ci amol musa kiyokay ka Pawan?
S.TRANSL: How does Pawan go to church?

S.FORM: paritensya musa kiyokay ka Pawan.
S.TRANSL: Pawan goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: tapanga’ su ci ceyun musa’ papasba’an ci ke’?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: aṟaṟt, tapanga’ cu ci basu’ musa papasba’an ci ke’.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: paritensy’a su musa’ papasba’an ci ke’?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ho’, pascitensya cu musa’ papasba’an ci ke’.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: patapanga su ci kawte musa Taka’o?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ho’, patapanga su ci kawte musa Taka’o.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: patapanga su ci kisya’ hala hikoki’ musa tayto’?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: patapanga’ cu ci hikoki’, halilaw tehuk ka hikoki’ laha ci kisya’.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: patapanga’ su ci basu hala patauṟit ci ṟaṟulu’ musa’ kiyokay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: patiuṟit cu ci ṟaṟulu’ musa kiyokay, umabas mamicuw tehuk ka pati’uṟit ci ṟaṟulu’ laha ci ka tapangan basu.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: hunsebeh moṟow mamu’ ka sobay?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: tapanga’ cu ci otobay musa sobsy, tuhya’ haṟi wa.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: sibeh papasba’an ci ke’ ka yubing?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: sibeh wa, tehkan micuw i maskakiy.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: sibeh nanan ṟaṟulu’ ka nanean?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: matata’ nanon ṟaṟulu’, maskakiy tikiy la ga, tehuk la.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: mahnguw su soni?
hunco’ la?
mak musa cu matisal sinang.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: babuw ni la wa, aṟat cu pakiki moṟow kira’ kelan na a’usa mu.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: mahnguw su cuxan? halan misu malahang gaben kay?
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你？
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: ho’ ga, non misu moṟow mu.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: silu’ing misu kay? papatasan mu ka pintasalan ta.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: ho’! anak ga.
silu’ing misu kay?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: iya’ aw. becu ramas taxan, mahahubu’’ ka kuhu’ mu uṟi’.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: pasasinga misu tana’ la.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: iya’ cu pasasingi’ uṟi’.
bahbah su, patisalung haku.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: ini’ haco’, amol ka kakaṟal su?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: amol pinmahun su ci ka se’eneng su hang?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: minkensacu’ cu rali’ hang, malax cu micuw la.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: kelan pumahun su micuw na?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: nel cu musa mumaṟah papasba’an ci ke’.
nel maki alang ka ule’ su uṟi’?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ini, cel maki alang yaba’ ka ule’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: makinbuti’ su nak maki’?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: tutux ka huṟil lu utux ka kabahni’ nel mu rangon, yominna utux moṟow.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: utux ka ngaw nel mu rangon uṟi’, inikinu’ ka kelan na gagigan.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: magamol ka gagaṟux na muloṟak mamu’ hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: aṟat payux ka kinnuba’ mu, ga’ pa’ucan misu ci kinnaba’un mu.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: magamol ka gagaṟux mamu ci babingun na musa maloṟak?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: ini pabingi’ kanel ka babingun na maloṟak hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: musa lunuli’ maloṟak ka kanel uṟi’ aw?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: ini’ usa lunuli’ maloṟak ka kanel uṟi’.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Piyu, usa miniy ci aguw ungat aguw moṟow ta la.
S.TRANSL: Piyu，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Piyu, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: cel pabitaṟakan kutux susuk na, iya’ biniy hang!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: ini’ tana’ utux susuk, usa’ miniy sa’ing susuk moh su kay.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: pabiniy cu ci aguw, kelan baninarun mamu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: kelan wa! pira’ ka binarun su?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: sa’ing susuk binarun mu, lu pabiniy cu utux cinnabon na box na.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: nel ka box, amol ka babinarun su na?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: pabiniy cu ci baṟing na, kelan mamu?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: wal su’un miniy ka baṟing min la.
pabiniy cu ci lukus.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: magamol ka gagalun su aṟ?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: pabiniy cu ci purung uṟit na lukus.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: magamol ka matanah hani?
kelan iro’ lanlamu’ na?
kelan na malabu’ lu mukaṟal. uṟɨ’.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: bi’i’ cu tutux lukus mukaṟal aw.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Sapu, minsa su inu’ ci micuw? minsa su ṟumuy ci hi’?
S.TRANSL: Sapu，你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Sapu, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: aṟat, minsa cu rumow pabiniy ci ṟagu’ ni yaki mu.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ux, mahnguw su malahngan? moh su gunluw mani mami’ kinang.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: aṟat cu, maha cu miniy ci lukus.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: han misu guluw musa aw?
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: ramas su, pira’ utux binnahlan ka ragu’ hani?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: mapusal ka utux binahlan ṟagu’ hani.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pira’ ka ngahi’ hani?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: matul ka utux toting ngahi’ hani.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: bi’i’ cu tikiy ci ṟagu’ sa’ing binahlan lu ngahi’ utux toting.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Piyu’, nel cu ṟumungi’ maras ci papatas la, pakacikiy cu hang?
S.TRANSL: Piyu，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Piyu’, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ungat ka kinang uṟi’, Yuman ka hani.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is yuma’s.

S.FORM: kacikiy ta tikiy hang? sibi’ misu micuw.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ho’, gali’ ga.
bahbah su, kaṟali’ tikiy ka Yuma uṟi kay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Yuma for me.

S.FORM: amol ka gagalun su na?
nel cu moh sumatu ci sa’ing patas hani.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ho’ga, amol ka gagalun su nan?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: pakacit cu ci tugal patas hani na.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ho’ ga, iya’ ṟungi’ wahi’ matu’ maktugal kay.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: ini’ suku’ pabinahi ka papuṟut mu na.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: wal misu pabinahun hira’ la.
hunco’ mu ini taxi’ ka papuṟut mu la?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了？
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: ye su wal pakacikan Pawan la?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Pawan?

S.FORM: ini’ mu ba’i’, hali’ mu ma’ut ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: pakaciki’ misu ka papuṟut mu hang.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Yuma, pinkacikan sinang ni Pawan ka lukus pababawen hani?
S.TRANSL: Yuma, did Pawan lend you this coat?

S.FORM: aṟat wa, bininiy kinang ni yaya mu ka hani.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mintana sinang ka lukus pababawen ni Temu.
S.TRANSL: Temu’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: makalux ka pababawen ni hiya ini pintana’ ka iro’ min.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Temi, kunacik su ci pila’ ni Piyu?
S.TRANSL: Temi, did you borrow money from Piyu?

S.FORM: ho, halan mu matu’ lake’ kira’ hiyan, ga, ṟumungi’ cu maras ci pila’ la.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: kanon babe’en suku la?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: han mu matu’ cuxan la.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ho’ ga, han mu kumaṟal ka Piyun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Piyu for you.

S.FORM: cubay hiya ga, karapun na katu’ pasiliy ka olit hiya lu piyuri’ ga, kaṟapun na waṟu’ hiya.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: kuba’ nak yonani, yaga cubay ini’ bah magal, maguṟuw ka pinsa’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了，難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: pasba’un misu subale’ ci katu’ sa’ing hani.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ho’ wa! at kinramasan! pa’agal cu babuw ni la.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: hamagal ka keweh cel soko’, babawi’ ka kaman mumaṟah ta la, mamaha’ ta mumaṟah.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: cel puson inu’ ka keweh?
maṟuk su soko’ la ga, cel bang na baluku’ taxan su la.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: taxi’ haṟi kay, pihuṟi’ ka keweh haca.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷，鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: iya kilkahi’ ka katu’ mu kay!
cel inu’ ka katu’ su?
cel yahu’ na kahuni’ ka katu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: hunco’ su ka ba’un?
ba’un mu nak pinsa’ mu’ katu’ hani, cel nak ki ka pinkegal mu.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: kobu’ kani, papuson min syaw na luling kakaṟak ci ucyux.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: ungat la kobu’ camingan, panyek min na baboli’ cami.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: aṟat cu mining ci panekan na, pasba’i’ haku’ babuw ni la wa?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ho’ ga! pagluw ta musa’ panyak babuw ni la.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: pasba’un misu sunbale’ ci kobu’ babuw ni la.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: cel maṟuy ka panekan su la ga, kelan na ucyux tari’un la! as hulu’i’.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: iya’ hang kay, maṟuy caṟung ka hune’ hani, pahuluy cu sani ci panekan, hemagal ka ami’ mu cel saca.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了，我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: hulu’i’ sani ka ucyux su, ragan misu humuluy.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: at kinramasan caṟung soni wa! pahpunan na ucyux kora’ ka ami’ la.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: nainah ta magiy, halan ta mapuli’ ka cel moṟow haca.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: nel sinsi’ la.
tatama’ la, iya’ salahaw la.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: sasaṟux la wa! sunṟahu’ cu la.
nahaṟi’ maṟuk ga.
pira’ rex soni’?
rex ṟamagal soni’, mahnguw cuxan la, hata magluw salahaw aw?
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧?
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ho’ ga! hata’ syaw na luling.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: pira’ rex cuxan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: rex tugal cuxan, hata’ salahaw boru’ cuxan gaben aw?
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧?
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: pisco’ su’ cuxan sasan?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: pahngagan rex cuxan, maha’ min kiyokay ci yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ la?
makmuta’ cu, maha’ cu pastanuxan.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: mamuy ka tunux mu.
pastukung tikiy mahnguw hang.
sinsi’, muxal ka labos mu, maha’ cu mastanux.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ho’, nahaṟi’ musa’.
anak cu musa’ mema’ ci aba’ ga?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: usa’ kira’ haṟi la, pahnguw ta’ haṟi la.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi’, muxal ka tunux mu, pahnguw cu gaben la.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ho’, katox haṟi musa’ su’ moṟow.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi’, pahnguw cu babuw rex utux hani, maha’ cu paktox ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ho’, bale’ malahang ci hi’ su’.
cel inu’ ka Iwal?
muxal ka labos ni, cel mastanux.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka Temu?
sinsi’, cel muxal na olu’ ka Temu, mahnguw soni’.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Temu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: hunco’ ini’ awah ka Temi?
cel makilux ka tunux ni.
kaṟal tikiy ni isu’.
Watan Nawi cu kung, malapṟow ingkaṟalan mu la.
S.TRANSL: My name is Watan Nawi, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ su’?
Watan Nawi ralu’ mu.
ule’ su’ itaṟal inu’ isu’?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: ule’ cu na Itaṟal kung.
itaṟal kora’ utux moṟow su’?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ho’ wa, Itaṟal kora’ utux moṟow min.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是泰雅族人。
Yes, my whole family is Atayal.

S.FORM: Itaṟal kora’ utux moṟow su’?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: aṟat, Itaṟal ka yaba’ mu hiya’, Pamukan ka yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是泰雅族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: ule’ su’ ni ima’ ka isu’?
ule’ cu ni Watan Nawi kung.
yaba’ su’ ka haca? pira’ ingkaṟalan ni la?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: matṟu mapgan ingkaṟalan ni la.
yaba’ su’ ka haca? pira’ ingkaṟalan ni la?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: aṟat, nabkis alang min ka hiya’, maspat mapgan ka ingkaṟalan ni la.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pira’ ingkaṟalan naka asuṟan su’ malikuṟ la?
malapṟow maspat ingkaṟalan naka asuṟan mu malikuṟ la.
mastuhya’ la ingkaṟalan mamu ci asuṟan su’ malikuṟ?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: ṟamagal ingkaṟalan la sa min.
kito’ su’ kinbabawen?
utux kabhul maspatul ka kinbabawen mu.
buse’ ta’ ini’ pakakatox la, ya su’ wal murkes la?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ho’ wa, utux kabhul matul kinbabawen mu la.
wal su’ katuhuṟ la ong?
ini’, makna’u su’ matox la.
mahikang su’ la?
ini’, katuhuṟ cu la.
katuhuṟ su’ la?
ho’, matul toting kinsagan mu micuw la.
maha’ su’ inu’?
maha’ cu malahang sinsi’ pankongsu.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: maha’ inu’ ka Yawi?
maha’ pabuling ci upak.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka Yawi?
cel lalanguyan ki, pacacapung lumanguy kira’ haṟi ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka Yuma? pacacapung tumalang kira’ haṟi ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Yuma在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Yuma? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: cel pasasilen ki, hali mu malawa’.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: pagluw ta’ musa’ patatalaman ga.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: maha’ cu miniy ci nani’un cakan rex hang, halan misu’ malahang kira’ haṟi la.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: pagluw ta’ musa’ rumili’ ci tinbili’!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kalahang ci ci’uli’ ka isu’, maha’ cu malahang sinsi’ kung.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: pacacapung tumuting ci boru’ kira’ ka Yawi aw?
S.TRANSL: Is Yawi competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: aṟat, pacacapung mastaṟil ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: macacapung tumalang ci kaca ga, pacacapung su’ uṟi?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ho’ aṟ, pacacapung cu matatalang.
macacapung tumalang ci kaca ga, pacacapung su’ uṟi?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: pacacapung cu tumuting ci boru’.
pisco’ ta’ patatalaman ki ci kaca ka ita’?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: pacacapung ta’ mahahuluy ka ita’.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: paginbiniy ta’ ci nani’un matatalang ci kaca?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: aṟat, paginbiniy min ci yayupun.
hapṟow su’ caṟung! magal su’ ti’imin!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶!真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: bahbah su’.
cel moṟow ka yaki’?
cel, cel mabel abelan ki.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: cel moṟow ka yaki’?
ungat, wal tanux ci micuw, malahngan unel ni moṟow la.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: cel moṟow ka yutas?
cel mabel nikay. hali malahang bawi’ ga.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: kelan ci’uli’ nel moṟow?
kuba’ nak Temi, buse’ misu’ ini’ taxi la, ramas su’?
S.TRANSL: 是Temi阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Temi. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: ramas cu ay! moh cu matisal sinang.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: cel inu’ ka yaba’ su’?
cel patakalux ci ṟagu’ nane’an ki, hali mu malawa’ hang.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: wal inu’ ka Yuma la?
wal kunṟak ci gilung ubu’ gilung ki.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: yutas, nel min la.
ungat moṟow yutas mamu. cel mumaṟah, na’ moṟow hiyan ga.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: mama’, nel su’ la!
buse’ ta’ ini’ pakakatox la, wal su’ murkes la.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: ma’as cu caṟung matox sinang.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: ni ka saputu’ hani, hali pusa’ pingsyang hang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: talagay su’ kinbuse’ ini’ awah la! sipalawa’ mu moh mani’ kora’ naha hang.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: eri’ nak la, ma’abu’ cu ci ocya laga ramas la. papatisal ta’ cacka’ na moṟow.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: bahbah su’ caṟung, maha’ cu moṟow la.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: nah na kinut ka gilung hani. aras moṟow sahyawi mani’.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: pakakatox ta’ cuxan gaben aw?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ho’ ga, pakakatox ta’ inu’?
pakakatox ta’ papasba’an ci ke’ aw? paluing ta’.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: hata’ pasasilen ki ga, palukus cu ci lukus itaṟal musa’.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: ramas taxan ka ṟapak na aṟimux i makṟapak ka alang min. awah malahang kinang i makṟapak laga.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: as ka non nanu pakabagan la ong, buse’ caṟung la!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: awah sungsung kunloh la ga.
S.TRANSL: 那你收穫祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: ho’ ga, paslamoh cu caṟung.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ maha’ maki alang la?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: maha’ cu pasba’ ci patas.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ ini’ pasba’ patas alang banux?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: lunglung cu nak alang mu, hita cu cumik nak ci alang mu.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: ba’ su caṟung tuminu’, ima’ pisba’ sinang?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: yaki’ mu, ba’ caṟung tuminu’ maki’ alang ka hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: hunco’ su’ maksunbaba’ tuminu’ ka isu’?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: gagaṟux min nak ka tuminu’, maklumuhing cu nak ci gagaṟux mu.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: ramas caṟung abun ka aguw cubay hani.
sinbale’ mu nak.
ba’ su’ caṟung wa, buse’ sinbale’an ka hani?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini’, utux ṟinogan laga tana’ la. mahu’il tinahkan ka rangil lu box laga, imagun ci tamul kaca ka puson tahan la.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: amol kora’ pabinarun su’?
kelan na urik lu inuw kucun, pinmuhi’ mu nak kora’ kay!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: binarun mu kora’ sa’ing, maha pira’ pila’ la?
sa’ing kabhul marimal karetan kora’.
kisli’ mu ka lukus hani, pira’ pila’ la?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: ṟamagal kabhul kani.
maskitu’ caṟung la, ṟakah mahyuw haṟi aw?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: ṟakah, mahyuw caṟung laga maha cu parara’iy la.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ho’ ga! pa’agal cu tutux ci makalux na lukus.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: galun mu ka buli’ lu tepeh hani.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mapusal kabhul kora’, sinbale’ mu nak na aba’ ka hani, maha su’ buse’ bingun.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: anak mahyuw haṟi na? pa’aras cu ci rangi’ mu moh miniy.
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: ho’ ga! hawe’an misu’ miniy.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll get you a discount..

S.FORM: awah awah matox, kelan kora’ ka lukus lu tamuku’.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: pira’ pila’ ka lukus hiya’?
utux lukus ga tugal ṟamagal kabhul, tugal lukus laga malapṟow kabhul la.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tana’ utux binarun mu la, bi’iy cu ci ga’aṟus ni.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: ramas su’, makminiy cu ci mami’ rangil lu asinuw pinnahkan na ma’uw.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: masu’ miniy ka mami’ hiya’ la, kelan cu na tana’ kapah na, pabiniy su’ aw?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ho’ ga! bi’iy cu tutux, mamoh cu miniy ci mami’ babuw ni la.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ho’, ta’uṟiy mu kapa, marimal karetan kora’.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
